headline.main: ONE WEEK LATER FROM EUROPE; The Belgian Ministry. THE COLONY OF NEWFOUNDLAND Cotton Advanced-Breadstults Unchanged, PRUSSIA'S POSITION. EX-MINISTRY OF DENMARK IMPEACHED. ARRIVAL OF THE BALTIC. Progress of the Vienna Conference, AFFAIRS IN THE CRIMEA UNCHANGED, STORMING OF REDOUBT. THE FIRST POINT ACCEPTED

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamer Baltic, from Liverpool Saturday, the 24th ult., (1 P.M.,) arrived at New-York Friday noon. The new screw steamer City of Baltimore, belonging to the Liverpool and Philadelphia Steamship Company, was brought round to Liverpool from the Clyde on the 17th. The City of Baltimore is the longest screw steamer in the world.

docs.lead_paragraph: From Dr. HENRY G. Cox, President of the Medical Board, and Physician in Chief to the Emigrant Refuge, Ward's Island, we receive the Annual Report of the Board for 1854. The number of patients cared for in the Hospital during the year was 15,950--701 of the number having been born there. The number of inmates on the 1st of January, 1855, was 3,168;

headline.main: The Massachusetts Nunnery Committee.; Additional Charges and Proof.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Committee of Inquiry appointed by the Leislature are very dilatory about their work. They were appointed, if we understand rightly, to clear up certain charges and imputations against the fair fame of the State and the credit of its legislators. A prima facie case has been made out; and until the charges are investigated, the State and the legislators rest under ignominy.
docs.snippet: The Committee of Inquiry appointed by the Leislature are very dilatory about their work. They were appointed, if we understand rightly, to clear up certain charges and imputations against the fair fame of the State and the credit of its legislators....

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; CHAMBER OF COMMERCE. Remonstrance Against the Incorporation of the Hurigate Navigation Company. FIRE DEPARTMENT. Meeting of the Fire Department Committee. CITY SCHOOLS. Board of Education--Finances, &c. MEDICAL. Academy of Medicine. Injunction Against the Nicaragua Transit Company. SUPERIOR COURT SUPREME COURT

docs.lead_paragraph: The regular meeting of this body for the current month was held yesterday (Thursday) in the Directors' Room of the Merchants' Bank, Mr. PELATIAH PERIT in the Chair. Mr. THOS.HICKS was chosen Secretary pro tem. The minutes of the previous meeting wore read and approved.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; POLICE DEPARTMENT. The New Police Bill--Correspondence Between Mr. Gerard and Mayor Wood. OYSTERS. The New-York Oyster Trade. THE "VEHICULARS." The Street-Cleaning Machines. How People will be Stupid. Commissioners of Emigration. The British Recruits and Neutrality Laws. Opening of a New Judicial District Court. Eastern Dispensary. Illness of the Assaulted Embroideress. Wicked Dogs. Loss of Life by Camphene. Passing Counterfeit Bills.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have received copies of a correspondence which has just passed between JAMES W. GERARD and Mayor Wood, in reference to the New Police Bill. Mayor WOOD'S letter is as follows:

docs.lead_paragraph: The third reading of the bill for the suppression of intemperance, pauperism and crime, was the special order in the Senate at 4 o'clock, yesterday afternoon. At that hour there had assembled one of the most crowded and interested audiences that I have ever seen congregated within the walls of the Senate Chamber.

byline.original: Special Correspondence of the N. Y., Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: When in the course of the proceedings of the late meeting of the Board of Managers of the American Bapist Missionary Union, it was adjudged necessary to disturb the grave of ELISHA L. ABBOTT, in order to elucidate the troublesome question of the Maulmain Councils, there were hearts which shrank from the task as from a profane service.
